simple to make so delicious here we go

right because I want to get to as flat
as possible halves all right so whatever
the widest point of the potato you're
going to cut right down through take
your time make it even now because you
got those nice flat halves now very easy
to make thirds okay so each one of those
halves gets cut into three it's going to
give us twelve pieces all together did
you cut them the other way lengthwise
through the the thinnest part you would
add it's just it would be tougher to
make the wedges so you'll see what I
mean when you cut these that's the only
way to screw this up is to have
different sized pieces all right so in a

anything fresh herb even so put a nice

some black pepper and salt
you got a seasoned potato as well as you
know there's nothing worse than under
seasoned potato fry or potato wedges
like this it just tastes flat so make
sure you give it a nice healthy dose
salt and pepper
and what we're going to do here we're
going to drizzle in a couple tablespoons
of olive oil now here's where I just I
really feel like a genius I see on TV
all the time these chefs they're cutting
the potato wedges they lay them out on
the sheet tray and then they try to
sprinkle herbs and oil and salt pepper
on the potato and it's all going all
over the pan great drives me crazy this
is so easy put it in the bowl that way
all your seasoning all your flavoring is
going on the potato then put it on the
pan all right
so again I just feel so smart right now
all right now here's another little
trick that is a baker's silicone baking
mat you can find those at Bed Bath &
Beyond any restaurant supply store so
great it's made of silicone nothing will
stick to it include
in potato wedges okay now anyone that's
ever tried these on a regular pan around
foil you know what I'm talking about all
right you got the spatula you're
scraping it trying to you know they're
crispy you just can't get them off the
pan that's not going to happen here
these are going to come out nice and
crispy and and crusty and golden brown
and you're not going to have anything
stuck to anything else
so get one of these mats they're great
for cookies and things like that
but I like it for these potatoes so
we're going to put them that side down
I'm going to put them in the oven for 20
minutes at 425 alright nice hot oven I
took them out after 20 minutes I gave
them a flip as you see here and they're
going to go back in for another 15 to 20
minutes until they're nice and crusty
and golden brown all right
so about 40 minutes altogether 32 for
you be the judge depends on the size of
the potato and then once they're done I
flip them up on the skin side and I just
turn the oven off and I just leave them
in the warm oven and they stay nice and
crusty and delicious and man those are
really good and they go good with
anything I'm not going to tell you what
they go with because you know all right
so there we go
crusty herb potato wedges again the
trick is season them in a bowl not on
